description: Erection of rear dormer roof extension with installation of 2no front roof lights to facilitate loft conversion
decision_conditions: The proposed erection of rear dormer roof extension with installation of 2no front roof lights to facilitate loft conversion falls within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class B & Class C of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

We have received the email confirmation for the site address, previous application number and conditions, please provide all those information in the application form. Please amend the whole application form with correct information.

-- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Act, Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents.Consultation MCAAC - no objection. Positive support Historic England - ProposalListed Building Consent is sought for the refurbishment of existing building replacing windows and internal works to kitchen and bathroom and flooring. The property is a Grade II statutorily listed building. The listing reads Heritage Category:Listed BuildingGrade:IIList Entry Number:1358431Date first listed:06-Oct-1983List Entry Name:23, POPLAR GROVEStatutory Address 1:23, POPLAR GROVETQ 26 NW KINGSTON-UPON-THAMES POPLAR GROVE4/6 No 23IIMid C19. 2 storey house with 3 bays facing Poplar Grove, a 2 bay return to Acacia Grove and a slightly recessed rounded corner. Yellow brick with stucco ground floor window and door dressings (stucco architraves and console-bracketed cornices). Gauged flat heads to upper windows. Cast iron window guards. Brick band between storeys. The return elevation matches the front. Slate roof with deep eaves.Listing NGR: TQ2094968634AssessmentThe application is assessed against section 16 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.The section states that(1 )Subject to the previous provisions of this Part, the local planningauthority or, as the case may be, the Secretary of State may grant or refusean application for listed building consent and, if they grant consent, maygrant it subject to conditions.(2)in considering whether to grant listed building consent for any works thelocal planning authority or the Secretary of State shall have special regardto the desirability of preserving the building or its setting or any features ofspecial architectural or historic interest which it possesses.(3)Any listed building consent shall (except in so far as it otherwiseprovides) enure for the benefit of the building and of all persons for the timebeing interested in it.The proposal is for the refurbishment of the existing property to include replacement windows, kitchen and bathroom, fireplace and flooring.It is considered that the proposed works would enhance the building's appearance and special architectural features and its historic interest.It is considered that the proposal would meet the test of section 16 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.It is recommended that the Listed Building application be granted.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal--- Informatives ---Positive and ProactiveIn dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.
